website_summaries.verdict: The best way to buy a large supply of standard road inner tubes for a season or more worth of replacements.
pros: High level of performance and durability
Tubes fit a variety of different road bike tire widths
Wear-resistant, and lasts longer than budget inner tubes
cons: Valves can pop out and get stuck inside a bike pump during inflation

customer_reviews.title: Something as easy as removing the protective cap or using a schrader ...
customer_reviews.text: The valve cores on these are extremely weak. They don't seal well and oftentimes when you unscrew the cap the the valve core comes loose as well, blowing all of the remaining pressure out. Something as easy as removing the protective cap or using a schrader adapter shouldn't do this every time you try to top up the air in your tube. I tried three of the five tubes and they all did this. I have every reason to believe the other two will as well. Save yourself from extreme frustration and stay away.
customer_reviews.author: fgdsfds

customer_reviews.title: Puzzled
customer_reviews.text: I have been cycling for years and have a favorable opinion of Continental products. Their Gatorskin tires are the best. While using them in the past I have gone months without a puncture or flat. However when I recently put new Gatorskin tires on, I also purchased these inner tubes. Two weeks later, all five are in the trash due to flats/holes. There were no punctures, just one flat after another due to holes in the inner tubes. I went to a local bike shop and switched to a different brand which had a thicker tube. The flats stopped. Still happy with their tires... but a bit puzzled as to what happened with these tubes.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Conti makes the best, longest lasting tubes, hands down. This pack contains a 5 pack so you get a better price, and they throw in a couple of nice tire irons! Great deal. Also, I run 28's on my road bike (Continental Gatorskin) but I use these which are rated for 20-25. I have found that it is fine to put a "smaller" tube in a bigger tire as the tube just expands a bit - the other way around is not a good way to go, though, because the tube can be pinched.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Valente

customer_reviews.title: two of them had the valve cores come out super easily and get stuck in my pump
customer_reviews.text: Three of the five failed almost immediately, two of them had the valve cores come out super easily and get stuck in my pump. Never had that happen with any other tube before. EDIT: Just want to ammend this, I did some research and I guess it's pretty standard for the removable cores to be a little loose from the manufacturer, and there is a little tool called a valve core remover that can help tighten it up (sounds like pliers or a small crescent wrench can work okay too). Wanted to add this for anyone else that is having the same issue. Bumping my review up to 3 stars (still had some tubes puncture seemingly too quickly).
customer_reviews.author: Chance St George

customer_reviews.title: Love them so far.
customer_reviews.text: Tubes feel nice and durable. I have 45 miles on my first two tubes and they're holding air just fine. Install was nice and easy on my 700x25C Mavic wheels with Continental GatorSkin tires. The tools that came with the tubes work great as well - long enough to get some decent leverage, pointed enough to get under the bead pretty easily, but round enough to not have any problems with pinches. Word to the wise - these tubes don't come with any powder on them, so either get something on hand to help with your install or be very careful to avoid pinching the tubes during install.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing price and accessory pairing
customer_reviews.text: I swear I need to order tubes by the pallet, because our roads here are dirtier than some third world countries. It pains me to pay ten bucks a pop for substandard tubes that sometimes fail for no reason at my LBS when I can just get the good stuff online and delivered for a fair price. I really like that they threw in the tire pries, it's nice to not have to dig in to my cycle pack for those when I'm fixing a flat at home. Heck, I might just take the two Conti pries which snap together, and put those in my saddle bag.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: All 5 yes FIVE tires all lasted all of 15 minutes of riding!!
customer_reviews.text: I was generally happy with continent products... I saw this five-pack and thought, what the heck, I'm always buying two-pack and three-pack tires, so YES to the five-pack bundle!!! All five tubes failed within 15 minutes of riding time! They all had the same exact leak... on the seam, directly on the opposite side of the stem (not on the rim side)... even changed the tire to be sure there wasn't something sharp, and then the new ones still leaked!!! I'm convinced this was a bad batch of tires. Continental, you lost my business!!!
customer_reviews.author: Al, Milford, CT

customer_reviews.title: These tubes are bad. 3 out of the 5 tubes I've used
customer_reviews.text: These tubes are bad. 3 out of the 5 tubes I've used, do not hold air over night. I ordered the right size (see picture). Had to take to bike shop to get it repaired properly. I should get a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Vineet

customer_reviews.title: Visit your local bike shop
customer_reviews.text: Bro, where do I start? Are these real ? Why do they feel so cheap? I prefilled 2 tubes to check them out. No leaks upon filling up. I installed on two rims utilizing the tools ( really helpful) the tires were fully inflated to 70 psi and were left on my wall as I finished typing an email. About 30 mins past and all you hear is two random pops and hisses, the damn tubes popped and weren't even mounted. Save your money .
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Boy Scout Motto: Be Prepared
customer_reviews.text: I have been only riding a bike with a Presta Valve for the past few months and though no one ever wants a flat or truly expects one, they happen and when it's a weekend in a city in America, the local Big Box doesn't carry these (or patch kits often), so having a spare handy helps especially because when I do find such a tube they often come at a premium. This kit means I now have one in my backpack and spares at home to get me through a year (or months... or weeks) of unfortunate flats.
customer_reviews.author: consumerNoise

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good enough. The people saying 3 out of 5 or more leaked immediately I would suspect aren't very good at swapping tubes and pinch the tube. I've used a full 5 pack of these. Only 1 flat due to a glass shard finding it's way to the tube. I haven't had any valve issues like others are saying, but the valves do feel a bit cheaper than some of the other tubes I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: I got a flat the first 20 min of riding with the first tube I used. It was probably a puncture so I will give them that. The second tube I filled up had warps not just one or two but line 5. The third tube o decided to air up before I put in on the rim it was mostly uniform except right by the air nozzle. I ride to work fine but totally not worth the money. Hopefully this tube I have in will get me home tonight.
customer_reviews.author: Captainbob

customer_reviews.title: Blow outs 😣
customer_reviews.text: 3 of them blew out within a mile of riding on them. Their QA department needs to stop slacking.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Positivity

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I got these as backups and recently had to use one. less than a week, i used all five. All five tubes lasted less than three miles each. Each one blew at the seam and a couple of them while not even riding the bike. Now i am stuck without a bike and it is my only transportation. I am in a location where i cannot just go off base to get more. I am not walking three to five miles a day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I use these with all my road bikes, mostly with Gatorskin 700c x 23 mm or Schwalbe Delta Cruiser Cream 700c x 35 mm tires. Haven't had any bad ones, and they last as long as I can keep broken glass out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Autodidact

customer_reviews.title: Great tubes.
customer_reviews.text: I used these tubes for all my road bikes and they hold up very well, Continental tubes and tires are what i have been using for many years and very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Back to Conti's
customer_reviews.text: I have been using tubes from a bicycling chain store and am back to Conti's. What is there to say? I put a little air in them before installing and on they go. Often I will put just a little talcum powder on the tube before installing as it keeps the tube from sticking to the inside of tire, significantly reducing the chances of a pinch flat. They don't leak, they hold air, the values seal, done.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I used the pry tool for the first time and it popped one of the tubes. But I bought these before and they go out quick, I dont know if it is the tube itself or the wheel tape. I walked my bike home at least 3 times(2mile hike) due to from riding over a small bump, debris, or shoulder lane.
customer_reviews.author: Shattered screen

customer_reviews.title: They Hold Air Quite Well
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about bicycle tubes if not for their ability to hold air? These Continental bicycle tubes hold air much better and longer than most tubes I've previously used on my bicycle. I've put about 500 KM on them so far and I've had absolutely no problems. I'm expecting these to be much more reliable than the ones I've previously purchased at my local bicycle shop.
customer_reviews.author: MW Brown

customer_reviews.title: Just ordinary tubes
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, the valve is slightly short even for the basic rims, nothing special. The extraction tools are very good, effective and durable
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Rudoy

customer_reviews.title: One Tube has failed after 3rd mile of pavement only use.
customer_reviews.text: Back tire tube failed on 3rd mile of use after replacement into brand new tires. I have a few replacements on hand and I am not sure if it was experienced installer error that caused this but highly unlikely. Due to that small doubt Im giving more stars than I would have.
customer_reviews.author: Trickyvickey

customer_reviews.title: Stems fail
customer_reviews.text: Thought these tubes were a good deal until I tried to use them to repair a flat while on a ride. Because I go on long rides out of Cell coverage I have learned to carry two tubes for insurance, but two of these tubes were not enough-both tubes had the cores fail when filled with CO2 - I have never experienced this in over 20k of rides. Luckily I only had a 2.5 mile walk to a rescue - could have been much worse earlier in the day. Don't buy these tubes!
customer_reviews.author: Happy User

customer_reviews.title: Buy these. You won’t get stranded
customer_reviews.text: Been riding for a number of years on these tubes. Very durable and have taken some hard punches from the roads here in North West Arkansas. I should have pinch flatted a number of times. The bundle from Amazon is one of the best I’ve seen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Karczewski

customer_reviews.title: Do you feel lucky punk do you?
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, these are a gamble. At first glance, they seem like a great deal. However, when you have to install 2 or 3 only to realize they have pinhole leaks around the valve, then you really realize how much you overpaid. I did not have any issues with the valve cores coming out prematurely. I highly recommend test inflating them and spraying with some soapy water to check for leaks prior to installing. I would chalk my experience up to a bad lot, but it seems like a lot of other reviews mention similar experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Better than most.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered some Michelin tubes to go with the Michelin tires I purchased at the same time. They were all terrible and leaked or popped shortly after installation. After getting the Continentals, I can see a big difference in quality. They work great and I won't be using another brand again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kauth

customer_reviews.title: better quality is worth it
customer_reviews.text: My last four inner tubes were replaced because the valve failed. The knurled nut came off or the inside seat started to fail or the inner valve assy started to unscrew and couldn't be re-installed. The tubes were low quality. These are a little more but great quality.
customer_reviews.author: JKH

customer_reviews.title: Constant problems
customer_reviews.text: Valves always break. Tires always go flat. Valves always break. Tires always go flat. Valves always break. Tires always go flat. Valves always break. Tires always go flat.... You get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Several were defective, slow leaks at a seam in the tube
customer_reviews.text: Two or maybe three quickly got slow leaks where there is a seam on the outside of the tube near the valve stem. I was surprised as this is a quality German manufacturer. I tried patching one but that seemed to make it worse.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of 5 Race 28 tubes, and 3 were defective. The tube circumference at the base of the valve was restricted, so that the tube did not expand fully in that area. As a result, once installed and inflated, the surrounding tube folded over and the tube burst just under the valve after riding for just a few miles. So I put in another name-brand tube and problem solved! I haven't looked at the other 2 Race 28 tubes, but my guess is that they are also defective. Won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product at good price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying this package for years. Quality Continental products include inner tubes & tires that last thousands of miles.
customer_reviews.author: DaleRanch

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Crafted Tire Irons and Defective Tubes
customer_reviews.text: The tire irons snapped when I tried to use them and, after examining two popped tubes, I noticed weird bulging. Overall, the bulging wouldn't have been unexpected with non brand names tires but I expected better here. The defective tire iron is completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Petrosky

customer_reviews.title: Solid tube
customer_reviews.text: Nice tubes at an OK price. Like that the Schrader stems are , threaded like a Presta, also the removable valve core.
customer_reviews.author: Pop N Wood

customer_reviews.title: Three went flat this winter on a trainer
customer_reviews.text: I have a Wahoo Core indoor trainer and a bike mounted that I use exclusively on the trainer. The rims are clean and as smooth as possible. Pinhole leaks developed three times this winter and I put less than 200 "miles" on the bike during that time. I would not use these on the road and would not suggest for indoor trainers either.
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy...
customer_reviews.text: So far, 4 of the tubes were defective from the get go. Before even putting them on, I put a little air in and heard it leaking. There were holes on different spots. Now I have 1 spare left. Wish I could have tried these on sooner. Now I'm stuck with 1 tube as a back up and no idea if it'll work or not...
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've installed several of the five tubes and so far two have leaked within days. As you can see from the picture this tube is constricted by the valve stem so doesn't fill the tire properly, stretches, and fails. The leak is at the seam on the backside of the valve. I checked my older Continental Race 700 Light tube and there is no such constriction and I have never had a leak in decades. Zero stars
customer_reviews.author: Kenton Fan

customer_reviews.title: Fairly priced, arrived quickly!
customer_reviews.text: New tubes arrived quickly and appear to be of good quality. I have yet to install them so durability is yet to be determined.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Consistently faulty
customer_reviews.text: I have now gone through four (4) tubes in just over a month (less than 100 miles). Two of them, the valve or valve-core malfunctioned. The other two, were punctured on a well-maintained road (and with Continental tires). I have never had to change my tubes so, so often, and biking habits have not changed since I bought these. Do not buy these, or you might find yourself stranded.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Overall have worked well
customer_reviews.text: Overall these have worked well, but one tube in the bunch was much more leaky than I would expect from a new tube.
customer_reviews.author: Evan S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Every tube in the bundle was damaged, each one popped/leaked within 5 minutes of inflating, real holes in the rubber, not due to over inflating.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan commanday

customer_reviews.title: A great price for a good tube.
customer_reviews.text: It needs a little more work to keep them full. About every two weeks you need to top them up. This is probably a little worse than average. The price is good though and they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Seems legit
customer_reviews.text: These are solid tubes and I have not had one pop yet. I've had them for maybe a month. Much better than the junk I bought from my local bike shop (those did not survive installation). The next time I need tubes, I'm buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Low quality.
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 5 tubes were faulty and low quality. Lasted one ride or less. All broke at seem near stem.
customer_reviews.author: MARK SAXELBY

customer_reviews.title: Still best Value in tubes
customer_reviews.text: Having been cycling for 30+ years I Have used less expensive tubes– poorer performance, shorter life cycle. I Have used more expensive tubes– no better performance, no improved life cycle. Have settled on Continental for best quality for reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hcantwell

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5, bad out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I can't recommend. I have had 4 of the 5 basically defective out of the box. Seems to be an issue on the tube, opposite the value stem. Small pin hole. After the 2nd one, mounting it, only to have it go down just after pumping it up, I started test inflating before mounting and 2 more were bad. Can't trust these to carry as a spare on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Staci M

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Quality tube, good price and removable valve so I can use my Enve valve extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Dana F. Ormerod

customer_reviews.title: Insanely high failure rate
customer_reviews.text: 4 flats, not a single due to puncture. All 4 have a split in the seam or a loose stem. Incredibly poor construction and/or quality control. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Crooks

customer_reviews.title: These tubes worked well
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy these tubes because others said they did not perform well and that their tubes had defects. For me, they have been satisfactory, it’s goat head season in my area right now so I’ve flatted, but only because of a punctures.
customer_reviews.author: Fred How

customer_reviews.title: Quality and toughness.
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, tough as well. Hit a pothole that blew up other brand of inner tube, this conti, not a problem. I ride every other day and, don’t have to put more air in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus V.

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 5 have flatted with less than 5 miles ride
customer_reviews.text: 11/6/2019: TRASH! Received these 11/2/2019 and 2 of 5 have gone flat already. First one lasted less than 3 miles at 100 psi. Thought it just may have been a fluke so I installed another one. Did a test ride @ 80 psi and flatted in less than 5 miles. Checked the tires but there are no punctures. Just a small hole in the tube. China made = poor quality control
customer_reviews.author: Shodid

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these tubes.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 flats in 3 days. Though the first tube flat was an actual puncture, the next 2 flats were factory defects as they split at the seam. I have 2 tubes to go in the pack and am contemplating throwing them in the trash since they will probably be bad as well. Considering all the negative feedback on these tubes they should be taken off this site. If not give us all refunds.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: You couldn't pay me to put these in my wheels
customer_reviews.text: Looks like they have factory installed patches on them? On my first ride on one of these, the tire went flat, turns out it had a very slow pinhole leak from the patch location. Almost got stranded over an hour from home, but luckily had a couple of CO2 cartridges and my own patches to get me home. Returned these as soon as I could and picked up some quality ones from my local bike shop. I had my doubts of the other reviews and figured I'd give them a shot... totally not worth it, these are trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jackman Works

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Tubes don’t hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Las Vegas and we aren’t even in the hottest part of the season yet. In 3 rides I’ve blown 3 tubes. I’ve barely gotten 20 miles out of each tube. There are noticeable tube bulges upon opening and quite frankly I feel I’ve wasted my money on these. Not even going to try to patch them. These are unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: these things puncture like there's no tomorrow
customer_reviews.text: had a 40-mile round trip commute. rei tubes would last for up to two months. these i'd be lucky to get a week out of. they do ride fast though
customer_reviews.author: Ian Carlton

customer_reviews.title: World class support.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tire levers as their design fails to damage rims. Best value, without compromising quality.
customer_reviews.author: Halloran

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 5 were faulty. Aired up to 110 and popped. Going to LBS next time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my 700 x 23C wheels, i like my pressure high and no blow outs yet.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favour and have a valve stem tool on hand... every one I’ve tried the valve stem is loose. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Kaie

customer_reviews.title: 3 flats in 7 days
customer_reviews.text: I ran my last set of tubes for over a year with no flats with my gatorskin tires. The latest batch I just bought has given me three flats within a single week on the same commute. That is absolutely ridiculous, will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: 2/3 Flat out of the Box and Counting...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the low price, thinking all tubes are made equal. Boy was I wrong! So far, I've tried 3 of these tubes out of the 5-pack. 2 of them had holes, straight out of the packaging. This was unfortunate to discover halfway through a ride. Do yourself a favor, and spend the extra $1 to get tubes that actually, you know, INFLATE.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Atherly

customer_reviews.title: Good tubes for road bike
customer_reviews.text: My wife gets a lot of flats so buy in mult packs
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gray

customer_reviews.title: Its value
customer_reviews.text: You hear all the time, continental this, or that. The tires for sure have its place on the market, i would like to believe that to tubes will do its best as well. Will update after burning through all of them first!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very good value.
customer_reviews.text: Good to have a tube supply for road bike tires. Flats happen when least expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Giacomello

customer_reviews.title: All had pin holes
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this was specific to seller or declining Conti quality controls, but all of these were defective tubes. Imagine the confusion when out on the road with a flat and carrying two extra tubes that also had flats. It was not the rim/tire, as I checked the unused tires and those also had pinholes.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Tate

customer_reviews.title: Good tubes. Durable and hold air really well
customer_reviews.text: Good tubes. Durable and hold air really well. Pretty much all I've been riding on for the last couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: These tubes work
customer_reviews.text: I've only used the first one of the pack so far but looking it over the manufacturing looked solid, the fit was perfect, the installation was easy and there has yet to be any problems. A well-priced pack of tubes that will likely keep myself and my girlfriend riding for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue
customer_reviews.text: I had problem with all 5 tubes i received and all of them get flat from same location underneath of pesta. I believe they are not original tube.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed lashgari

customer_reviews.title: Seem fine to me.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack. I am only using one now and it has no problems at all. The tire wrenches are an added bonus if you have none.
customer_reviews.author: TCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this product. First tube blew out immediately upon inflation of 60psi (I normally ride at 100psi). Second tube blew out before my first ride on the training stand was done (~30 minutes) . I should have dug deeper into the reviews... looks like this is a common issue with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Bicycle Tubes are Flawed.
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy these tubes. So far, three tubes have failed due to splitting seams. I have been road biking for 30 years and have never experienced anything so terrible. Tubes last for two rides and then go flat. The seams around the valve are splitting. I use 90 - 100 psi. Other brands last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kalski

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: good price, just wish I didn't have those sticker things in my grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: All tubes split at the seem.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it. All tubes split at the seems after a short ride.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Merhib

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE VALVE
customer_reviews.text: JUST GOT STUCK 10 MILES FROM HOME - WENT TO CHANGE A FLAT AND THE VALVE ON THE REPLACEMENT TUBE WAS DEFECTIVE - COST ME THE WHOLE MORNING AND MISSED A RIDE ON A BEAUTIFUL DAY - CHEAP TUBE
customer_reviews.author: JIMIJOMO

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: And great quality. I keep plenty on hand all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and good fit
customer_reviews.text: A good all around tube, reliable and the price is right
customer_reviews.author: Larry Singer

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that these tubes were bundled with tire ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that these tubes were bundled with tire levers. A cyclist always needs tubes, and I happened to need some tire levers, too.
customer_reviews.author: Tani Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Fit well
customer_reviews.text: These tubes fit and work well with the continental 25mm tires that I use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: No flats!
customer_reviews.text: I paired these inner tubes with my gator skin tires and for almost a year now I have not needed to change the tubes!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Tubes Had Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these and Gator Skins together. 3 out of the 5 tubes leaked so I guess that's a 2 out of 5 star rating, sending back for refund. Most leaks occurred around valve stem area. Good Luck
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkyRecipe

customer_reviews.title: Valve core separated
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other reviews, I had to pull the valve core out of my pump on the tube's first use. I also received 60mm valve stems after ordering 42mm. The tubes have been on my bike for about a week now with no other issues other than the massive stems sticking out of my rims.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Nwafor

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone through 4 of these in less than a month. Best one lasted 50 miles, worst was 2 flats within 6 miles on the same ride. Will never buy these again, stay away. Never had these problems with other brands from the LBS.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Knop

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the Best Tube
customer_reviews.text: Continental Tubes: If they weren't great, I wouldn't keep buying them the last 25+ years.
customer_reviews.author: ClayEE

customer_reviews.title: ROLLING ALONG CONFIDENTLY
customer_reviews.text: I always trust any bike tire or tube made by Continental in Germany. Worth the bit extra for piece of mind and good, consistent, quality.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P. Bud

customer_reviews.title: Good price but bad quality
customer_reviews.text: It's been about a month and I have already gone through 3 of them. I do like that they added the tools need to help change my tires/tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Entire batch failed at 20 psi
customer_reviews.text: I've good luck with these in the past, but the last batch were all duds. Could not fill past 20 psi.
customer_reviews.author: DLarsonRI

customer_reviews.text: So i guess my batch must of been bad because 4 out of 5 lasted a day each. I usually trust continental but this makes me hesitant to buy as a primary tire because i ride to work.
customer_reviews.author: domingo

customer_reviews.title: Whole Batch was defective
customer_reviews.text: Five tubes and all of them gave me a flat within 3 miles of putting them on. They all blew open at the seam with no visible intrusion into my tire. Tires have 100 miles on them. These all seem to have had a manufacturing flaw.
customer_reviews.author: C-Spokane

customer_reviews.title: Great quality as you would expect
customer_reviews.text: Conti tubes and tires are always the highest quality and race-worthy. Not much else to say, except the orange levers are kind of cool.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice tubes. No problem so far. Seems to be a good quality product. It fits all my road bike tires
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Junk....
customer_reviews.text: 3 out 5 lasted minutes. What else is there to say? We’re these even real or knock offs...
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We changed the tube for our road bike and so far it works fine. This pack will last a long while.
customer_reviews.author: CPAPC

customer_reviews.title: Dent in the inner tube????
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible tire. I do not know if I had some poor graded defected ones but 2 of them already popped and all the tires of a weird dent in them near the stem. I want a refund on these. I got it from this page and someone from mike deals.
customer_reviews.author: John Yoon

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: a great combo of tubes for bicycle tires and more of this brand and your gift of the pallets to take the covers great
customer_reviews.author: David Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of 5 of these. I've gone through 3 so far and every single one has developed a leak during its first ride. I'm just trying to use them up at this point and on the bright side, I am getting some good tube-changing practice. These were cheaply priced and in this case you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Danielson

customer_reviews.title: Eh?
customer_reviews.text: I kept getting flats and ended up having to buy Gatorskin tires.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morrissette

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived on time just as described excellent service
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as described on site , shipped on time and arrive perfect , already installed on bike perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: German Quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: I swapped out my stock road bike tires for Continental Gatorskins. I figured I might as well go all Continental and ordered these tubes. Very happy with the tubes and tires. German Quality.
customer_reviews.author: AES442

customer_reviews.title: Hope you’re good at changing flats.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 2 months ago, and have already used all 5 tubes and the tire levers already snapped in half. I should’ve known these were shady based on the price per tube. Love Continental tires, hate their tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Rifenburg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price for high quality tubes. The included tools are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Abrecht

customer_reviews.title: but I've used them before and they're perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet, but I've used them before and they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, good valves
customer_reviews.text: Tubes are easy to install, valves are top shelfs! Have been using these tubes for many years!
customer_reviews.author: rzagula

product_meta.title: Continental Bicycle Tubes Race 28 700x20-25 S42 Presta Valve 42mm Bike Tube Super Value Bundle (Pack of 5 Conti tubes & 2 Conti tire lever)
product_meta.description:
Color:Original VersionPack of 5 Continental Race 28 700x20-25 S42 Presta Valve 42mm Bicycle Tubes & 2 Continental Tire Lever. The Continental quality road inner tube is a must have cycling essential for 700c bike wheels.

This new ContiTube hose program makes it even easier to find the optimum hose for your needs. The very clear and user-friendly hose system was perfectly adapted in size, design, valve type and length to the respective tire sizes and applications.

Shorter valve inner tubes are ideal for wheels with rim depths of 24mm or 30mm but are not ideal for wheels with rim depths of 40mm or above (as the shorter valve would not extend out of the rim valve hole).

Presta valve tubes are most commonly used for road wheels (700c) and on a few MTB wheels as the valves are thin, whereas Schrader valves are more commanly found on MTB wheels as valve is larger and won't fit through 700c rim valve holes.
feature_bullets: Wheel Size: 700x20/25 (622), Valve: Presta (42mm), Claimed Weight: 105g
All purpose inner tube and excellent replacement inner tube for your road bike
Material: Butyl tubes with renowned Continental quality
Durability: Each and every inner tube passes a stringent 100% quality control inspection
Design: Seamless construction, with a mould-cured vulcanisation, to ensure uniform roundness and give a smooth ride and handling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars573 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
